description.narrative: -Development of Ukraine''s infrastructure based on modern and safe standards. -Access to high-quality petroleum products and services. -Employment creation / preservation: The investment is expected to create 380 to 480 new, permanent jobs. -Development of local suppliers: Convenience stores, automotive services and fast-food help local economies because such services at stations are primarily locally supplied. -Support of cleaner fuel types: GNG offers liquified petroleum gas (LPG) in many of its filling stations, and the new stations will also offer this cleaner fuel alternative.

Public Joint Stock Company Concern Galnaftogaz is based in western Ukraine and operates the second largest petrol filling station network in Ukraine by volume under the OKKO brand. Galnaftogazs petrol filling stations are built in a format common in western Europe, comply with up-to-date technical and environmental specifications, and offer various related products and services such as convenience stores and restaurants. The purpose of the project is to support the expansion of Galnaftogaz through a) expanding the number of petrol filling stations, convenience stores, and liquefied petroleum gas modules, b) investing in infrastructure upgrades and measurement / control systems, and c) managing working capital risks by partially replacing short-term loans with long-term debt.

This project will support Galnaftogazs further expansion in all regions of Ukraine and will have a particular emphasis on expansion in the southern region.
